sentences.english: Hoping that this time it will remain a lullaby.
sentences.chinese: 多希望這一次，它將仍然是一首搖籃曲。

sentences.english: The mother was crooning a lullaby to her baby.
sentences.chinese: 母親正對着嬰兒哼着搖籃曲。

sentences.english: When Uncle Satchmo sings his lullaby.
sentences.chinese: 就在路易斯叔叔唱起他的搖籃曲時。

sentences.english: I think this song is a cradlesong that you seldom wrote before.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲這支歌是你好難得寫的一首象搖籃曲的作品。

sentences.english: The mother crooned her baby to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 她低哼搖籃曲使她的嬰兒入睡。

sentences.english: She sang them lullabies and taught them riddles.
sentences.chinese: 她給它們唱搖籃曲，教它們謎語。

sentences.english: With mom singing lullabies, the baby fell asleep quickly.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽哼着搖籃曲，寶寶很快就睡着了。

sentences.english: And sings her lilting lulabies in the arms of the winds.
sentences.chinese: 在風的懷抱中唱起輕快的搖籃曲。

sentences.english: Through his tears and grief, the song came, a deep and throaty lullaby.
sentences.chinese: 透過祖父的眼淚和悲傷，是一首低沉嘶啞的搖籃曲。

sentences.english: While bees in gardens hum the lullabies.
sentences.chinese: 當園子裏的蜜蜂輕哼著搖籃曲。

sentences.english: I kept the light on and I didn't hear the lullaby again that night.
sentences.chinese: 我把燈一直開着，那晚搖籃曲就再沒響過。

sentences.english: The mother was crooning a lullaby to her baby.
sentences.chinese: 母親正對嬰兒哼着搖籃曲。

definition: music notation in which the notes Do, Re, Mi, Fa, Sol, La and Si are represented by numerals 1 to 7
answering phrase of duet/to sing antiphonal answer
young people decked out in gorgeous clothes (idiom)
the return of a prodigal son (idiom)
The Drunken Beauty, Qing Dynasty Beijing opera
talking in one's sleep/delirious ravings/nonsense/sheer fantasy
double reed wind instrument (such as oboe or bassoon)
in perfect harmony/in sync/lit. qin and se sing in harmony
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
